FuncDef: This command overrides specific attributes of the specified queue s MBS parameters. A queue uses its MBS value to determine whether it has exhausted all of its buffers while enqueuing packets. Once the queue has exceeded the number of buffers allowed by the MBS, all packets are discarded until packets have been drained from the queue.

ParaDef.Info: The size parameter is an integer expression of the maximum number of kilobytes or bytes of buffering allowed for the queue. A value of 0 causes the queue to discard all packets. Values-0 to 1073741824, default.
Indicates that the size parameter value is expressed in bytes.
Indicates that the size parameter is expressed in kilobytes.
